comments: Medium value habitat. Low flow near culvert but as you get away (>50m) from it there's much better flow and habitat. Numerous deep pools and undercut banks. Not much cover in most areas. Abundant gravels suitable for spawning. Stream opens up after 100m and goes through cow pasture whre there's less cover and the stream becomes more coupled. 16:15

Medium value habitat. Abundant gravels present for spawning. Lower 150-200m of stream is heavily impacted by cattle from Buckrow Angus farm. Beaver present in lower section. Numerous fry throughout. Some deep pools to 0.7m available for rearing and overwintering for rainbow fry and juvenile. Frequent debris in stream. Cattle accessing stream intermittently to top of site. 16:18

Concrete slabs just downstream of culvert on both banks.  Dewatered.  Stream has been channelized through private property with riparian vegetation mostly removed. One passable culvert and two bridges located downstream. 11:06
Medium value habitat. Stream is dewatered at highway. Gravels present for resident and andronous salmonids. Infrequent deep pools for rearing and overwintering for salmonids. 12:50:07
No water until ~350m upstream. Medium value habitat. Once the water begins the habitat becomes better. Lots of gravels and cobbles suitable for spawning. Some deep pools and undercut banks. 12:58

Pool at 11:57 has fish ~10cm in length backing (180m ds of culvert). Bridge at waypoint 47(MW). Shallow pool ds of bridge. Trout backing? Concrete slabs on both banks us of bridge. Limited riparian veg due to farm. Not much overhead vegetation. Built up dams to form pools (livestock waterholes). Some garbage and debris in and around stream. Potential for higher value habitat but too much interference with property owners. Medium value habitat. 11:20

Medium value habitat. Good flow volume and decent amount of complexity due to boulders and undercut banks. Some small pockets of gravel suitable for resident rainbow spawning and potential coho.   Occasional shallow pools and traces of large water debris. Channel appears to be constricted due to agricultural development on both sides of the stream. Water withdrawal is occurring as well.  More agricultural development encroaching on the riparian farther upstream. Survey length 330 m. 11:32:40

Medium value habitat. Likely an important migration corridor, however the stream is heavily impacted by cattle chapel thanks and degradation related to cattle ranching And windthrow. Significant amounts of cattle manure in the stream likely putting water quality well above disgusting thresholds. Occasional pockets of gravel suitable for resident rainbow spawning. No fish observed. Boulders are the significant cover however there are just occasional pause with depth suitable for overwintering. Decent amount of hearing habitat for juveniles though. Small rock drop of 65cm is located 365m upstream of the top end of the culvert. 15:07:54

Undercut banks throughout providing good cover for fish. Abundant riparian vegetation providing cover and controlling temperature. Some gravels suitable for spawning. High value habitat, some fish spotted. Functional large woody debris throughout stream. 10:01

High value habitat. Abundant gravel is present suitable for spawning resident and anadromous species. Some deep pools present suitable for juvenile rearing and overwintering. Some evidence of large flow events likely due to Beaverdam blowouts upstream which have been reported by adjacent landowners. 10:30:31

Small beaver dam ~500m upstream. Some areas that are coupled, with embankment issues. Some fish spotted but not many. Wide stream throughout with abundant cover. Approx. 50m of open residential area on right bank. High habitat value with some areas with gravels suitable for spawning. 11:18

High value habitat. Abundant undercut banks available for cover. Some patches with gravels present suitable for RB/ST and CO spawning. Occasional deep pools present suitable for rearing and overwintering. Old growth mixed forest riparian. Site is adjacent to witset community. 12:01:59
Mostly riffle, occasional boulders. Pool at top of site. 11:03:07
Deep undercut bank at top of site. Mostly shallow glide. Fair amount of overhanging veg, most fish caught at top of site. 11:47:53
Abundant overhanging veg combined with undercut banks. Mostly riffles. Open site, less tree cover. Majority of section is a bend. 5 fish caught, distributed evenly throughout site. 12:04:20
Glide habitat with extensive small woody debris and some undercut on the left bank. Difficult to fish due to all the small woody debris. 13:38:58
Stopped at gravels. Site is one large pool with a big piece of large woody debris across the channel. 14:04:41
LWD at top end of site with pool underneath. Did not fish gravels on left bank. 13:20
Riffle habitat with one shallow pool at u/s end of site. No undercut banks. 15:55

Vegetated bar at top of site, providing cover for fish functional woody debris on left bank plenty of fish scooted out of.  Two rainbow trout were caught electrofishing more were sighted. Cobbles and boulders made up the stream bed for good quality rearing habitat. Healthy riparian. 15:24:52
Right bank is sloping. Red healthy riparian shrubs deciduous and conifers provide some shade but not much crown closure. 15:49:19

Shrubs and mixed forest riparian giving good shade from sun so 20 m from someones property on left bank. Stable large body debris in stream and along stream banks creating complexity and great fish rearing habitat boulders are present and very functional for cover. 16:08:56
Faster section with some boulders just before private land. 16:15
Decent habitat. Slow flowing stream. Stream is in town. Alot of waste and debris. Food for fish is abundant. Alot of cover from veg. Stream hits railway and is diverted west. 10:34:47
Excellent habitat quality. moderate flowing creek fish spotted all the way up to the waterfall. Active minnow trap found with many fish inside. Plenty of cover, shallow undercuts. 11:28:37

Medium value habitat with many undercut banks throughout, fish up tp 20cm long sighted throughout covered areas. Patches of debris. Cattle trail next to length of creek, some areas have embankment issues with ris of sediment falling into stream. Not many gravel patches suitable for spawning. 15:06
High value habitat with abundant undercut banks providing cover for resident fish. Some pockets of gravel present suitable for spawning. Large and small woody debris found throughout stream. 10:15:45
